meanings.definition: Lacking brightness or interest; dull or dreary.
meanings.sent1: The old house had a drabby appearance with its peeling paint and worn-out furniture.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather made everything look drabby and unexciting.
meanings.sent3: Even the most colorful flowers seemed drabby under the gray sky.
meanings.sent4: Her drabby mood matched the gloomy weather outside.
meanings.sent5: The drabby room felt like a forgotten corner of the house.

meanings.sent1: She chose a drabby brown for the walls to create a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The old photograph had turned into a drabby shade of yellow over time.
meanings.sent3: The artist mixed different paints to create the perfect drabby hue.
meanings.sent4: The drabby carpet blended in with the rest of the room's decor.
meanings.sent5: The drabby sky signaled the arrival of a storm.
